intro: Boechera burkii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, often found in open areas with well-drained soil. Boechera burkii has small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are basal and rosette-like, with a hairy texture that helps it retain moisture in arid conditions.
